page.title: 15Amesbury Carnival
page.content: Amesbury Carnival is a yearly event held on the first Saturday in June.It was reintroduced in 1979 as part of Amesbury's Millenium celebrations and has taken place every year since.It is a charity event from which local clubs and organisations benefit. In the week prior to the Carnival Procession there are many events starting with a Church Service and including a Massed Band Concert, Teddy Bear's Picnic, Pig Roast, Roller Disco Stretcher Race, Strong Man and Arm Wrestling Competitions, Majorette Competitions and a Carnival Dance during which the Carnival Queen is chosen.Over 15 floats took part in the 1985 Carnival from Playgroups, Clubs and Schools.There were also bands, majorettes and individuals in fancy dress.This revised tradition is a popular attraction in the town.
